comments.text: Hitchhiked with a local man heading north to Taba on his pick up truck with his two sons in the back. We couldn't communicate in language and the two boys wanted to give me all sorts of possessions of theirs for me to take. I gave them little funky wire men in return. I wanted to give their father some spare cash in return when he fuelled the car and he graciously refused over and over. Extremely kind and generous people. Simple human to human connection.

Well, hitchhiking in Egypt for faraway places won't just work due to military checkpoints all the ways and they don't let foreigners to specific regions with no planned trip(bus)

So the best is to go to GoBus office and get a ticket to wherever you need and it won't cost more than 10 euros. Good luck and please stay safe here.
Anywhere in Siwa is really easy and quick to hitchhike, everyone stops. It is the best way of getting around Siwa

To get here, take the metro to Helwan (1 EGP) and walk South for 15 minutes on Mansour until the traffic thins out. Then take any microbus (1 EGP) going further South until you reach the highway. There will probably be other people waiting for a bus or shared transport. Just walk a bit further and try to wave down cars. Best to take the highway El-Karimat El-Zafrana. This road is in  a very good condition and is being extended further and further towards Luxor.
to Farafra. there was no traffic at all but i was lucky and got a truck with 30km/h. at the end he asked me money but i rejected it.
Walk out of the ferry and get a ride here to Aswan. Be careful, many drivers may ask you for money. Also, you can get stuck in Aswan easily.
Near the train station, you can start here towards the north, but there's a lot of local traffic and taxis. If possible, get out of the city at all!
